solution_line_template: From babysitting Julie, Zoe made {julie_multiplier} * {zachary_earnings} = <<{julie_multiplier}*{zachary_earnings}={julie_earnings}>>{julie_earnings} dollars, since she made ${zachary_earnings} babysitting Zachary and she babysat Julie three times as often

Since she babysat Zachary 1/5 as often as she babysat Chloe, she made an additional {chloe_multiplier} * {zachary_earnings} = <<{chloe_multiplier}*{zachary_earnings}={chloe_earnings}>>{chloe_earnings} dollars from babysitting Chloe.

All together, the babysitting sessions made Zoe {zachary_earnings} + {julie_earnings} + {chloe_earnings} = <<{zachary_earnings}+{julie_earnings}+{chloe_earnings}={total_babysitting_earnings}>>{total_babysitting_earnings} dollars

Subtracting babysitting payments from the total gives {total_earnings} - {total_babysitting_earnings} = <<{total_earnings}-{total_babysitting_earnings}={pool_cleaning_earnings}>>{pool_cleaning_earnings} dollars
